result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. HAMPTON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Obtain high school diploma or its equivalent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to comply with any court order entered into if he is found to be, and adjudicated, the father of the child.

No contact with the victim without prior approval from the agent with the exception being birth, care and custody of the minor child.

Provide DNA sample.
The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. HAMPTON

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David L. HAMPTON
Current: 723 N. 9th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2015)
Prior: 3063 N. 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53201

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-22-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 09-24-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with S.A.G., DOB: 10-25-2000.   Bail furnished.    
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

RE:  S.A.G., DOB: 10-25-2000, on 04-01-15.
Initial appearance is set for 06-29-15 at 2:30 p.m.
